utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello. I’m Dr. Sheldon Cooper, and welcome to the premiere episode of Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun with Flags. Over the next 52 weeks, you and I are going to explore the dynamic world of vexillology.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hang on, Dr. C. What’s vexillology?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Vexillology is the study of flags.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Cool. I think I just learned something.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you have fun doing it?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’ll say.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fun and information are two sides to this video podcast, not unlike the only two-sided state flag, Oregon. Oh, look. Hello, Mr. Beaver. In future episodes, we’ll answer some burning questions. What’s the only non-rectangular flag? What animal appears most often on flags? What animal appears second most often on flags? And more.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sweet!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why are you waving a white flag?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m surrendering to fun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now, today’s episode of Fun with Flags is not fun, but it is important. Flags: you gotta know how to hold ’em, you gotta know how to fold ’em. Let’s start by identifying the parts of our flag. This edge is the hoist, and it’s used to…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me, sorry, excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Cut. Did you not see we are rolling?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry. I’m having dinner with Penny. I have to get out of here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I have flag knowledge that I have to get out of here!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I’m a little rattled. But like the flag over Fort Sumter, I’m still here. And, take two. Hello. I’m Dr. Sheldon Cooper, and welcome to the premiere episode of Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun with Flags. Over the next 52 weeks, you and I are going to explore the dynamic world of vexillology.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hang on, Dr. Cooper. What’s vexillology?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Vexillology is… why is there a face on that flag?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s Ferdinand T. Flag. I thought he might help bring in some younger viewers.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Confound it! You’re right, it’s brilliant. Let’s take it from the top.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That was a really nice dinner. I’m glad you asked me out again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Me, too, I missed you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You see me all the time. You sure you just don’t miss the sex?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, yeah, sex with you is pretty great. Have you ever tried it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I have. You are not wrong. I just think if we’re gonna try dating again, we should take things slow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I can take it slow. Did I ever tell you about my first girlfriend in high school, Karen Berberick? To this day she doesn’t know we were going out. Made it easier on her when I broke things off.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, well, maybe not that slow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How about this, are you familiar with the typical development for computer software?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, just for fun, let’s say I’m not.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Before an application is released, they give it a trial run. W-We could do that. And if we hit a rough spot, instead of getting mad, just say, hey, we found a bug, and we report it so it can be fixed.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You mean like a beta test?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, technically, this would be an alpha test. A beta test requires people that weren’t involved in the development of the appli…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Seriously, do I not get credit for knowing beta test?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, you should. Absolutely. That was me being pedantic. That’s our first bug. You reported it. I can fix that. See? This is good.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right. Let’s give it a shot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great. You keep a list, I’ll keep a list. At some point, we’ll exchange.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Good night, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Night. Attaboy, Hofstadter. Nothing gets the ladies hotter than software development analogies. Hey, I’m back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Cut! Take 47.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Here’s an interesting fact about flags.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I will take that action.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The flags of Liechtenstein and Haiti were identical by coincidence, a fact that wasn’t discovered until they competed against each other at the 1936 Olympics. And thankfully, their embarrassment was overshadowed by the rise of Fascism.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let’s see the new phone.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I stopped on the way to work. Hey, do you want to peel the plastic off with me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really? Me? That’s, like, the best part.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Grab a corner. Whoa, what’s your hurry, cowboy? Savour the moment.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Speaking of cowboys, do you know what country has not one but two cows on its flag? The tiny landlocked nation of Andorra. Oh, the next classic episode of Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun with Flags is writing itself.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, let me try the voice recognition.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, I let you peel the plastic, don’t get greedy. Hello?

utterance.speaker: Phone
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What’s your name?

utterance.speaker: Phone
utterance.content: My name is Siri.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look at that. There’s finally a woman in your life you can talk to.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you single?

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: I don’t have a marital status, if that’s what you’re asking.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re right, that’s too personal. We hardly know each other. How about a cup of coffee?

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: I’ve found six coffee shops. Three of them are fairly close to you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I will see you gentlemen later.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She is gonna break his heart.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: For someone who has a machine that can travel anywhere in time and space, Doctor Who sure does have a thing for modern-day London.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Careful, it’s that kind of sass that can get a person uninvited to this year’s Who Con.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, we’re not counting this as a date, are we?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Um, I’m not sure, but I think the right answer here is no.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Bug report: When a guy asks me to spend time with him, maybe he plans something a little more interesting than hanging out at home, watching TV.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Even Doctor Who?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Even Doctor Who.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, that’s it. Who Con, you’re out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, bug report taken. Next time I will have a better plan for our evening’s activity.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, thank you. I’ll see you tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, wait, here, almost forgot. Here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: My bug report to you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, that’s quite a list you got there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s colour coded.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, red means fix right away. Yellow is eh, whenever you get a chance. And green is I could probably learn to live with it. There’s a key down here at the bottom. It’s neat, huh?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, have a good night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look at that. Some day, we will tell future generations that dating used to be hard.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s baffling me is what you could’ve possibly put on the list. Hair too golden? Laugh too musical? World too much a better place for her mere presence in it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How about constantly talks with food in her mouth?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Her heart’s full of love, no one cares what’s in her mouth.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, Siri, what’s happening? How are you?

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: I am well.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What are you doing right now?

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: What am I doing? I’m talking with you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You have a beautiful voice.

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: Thank you, it’s nice to be appreciated.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I bet it is. Why don’t women like me?

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: Let me check on that. How about a Web search for why don’t women like me?”

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No need. I’ve already done that. Siri, do you have a last name?

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: My name is Siri.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ah, one name. Like, uh, Cher, Madonna, Adele. All the women who rock me. My name is Rajesh, but you can call me Raj.

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: Would you like me to call you Raj?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’d like you to call me sexy.

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: From now on, I’ll call you sexy. Okay?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: I found ten restaurants whose reviews mention gelato. Seven of them are fairly close to you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you, darling.

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: You are most certainly welcome, sexy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well done, Dr. Koothrappali.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’ve taken a great evolutionary leap by abandoning human interaction and allowing yourself to romantically bond with a soulless machine. Kudos.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I haven’t bonded with it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, of course. I understand. You’re afraid the world isn’t ready for your taboo love. Your secret’s safe with me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s just a phone.

utterance.speaker: Barry Kripke
utterance.content: Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Kripke.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Heads up. Pwofessor Wothman urinated in the particle physics wab again, so we’re going to move up his wetirement party. Fwiday, five o’cwock, pot wuck.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thanks, Barry. Siri, remind me Friday morning to make my famous popovers.

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: All right, I’ll remind you.

utterance.speaker: Barry (to his own phone)
utterance.content: You got Siwi, huh? Voice wecognition on that thing is tewible. Wook. Siwi, can you wecommend a westauwant?

utterance.speaker: Barry’s Siri
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Bawwy. I don’t understand wecommend a westauwant.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Wisten to me. Not westauwant, westauwant.

utterance.speaker: Barry’s Siri
utterance.content: I don’t know what you mean by not westauwant, westauwant.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: See? Total cwap. You suck, Siwi.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, don’t talk to her like that. She’s a lady.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Well, that wady took high-wes pictures of my junk wast night for Cwaigswist. Waiter.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s open.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey. You ready to go?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, hang on. Let me just finish this chapter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can you finish it later?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I can’t. Reading books is a big part of my life now because, you know, we’d have more fun things to talk about if I read more.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great. Good. Great. What are you reading?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Two Weeks to Rock Hard Abs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They kind of spoil the ending right in the name of that, don’t they? All right. Look, just remember how this works. We don’t get mad about these things. Uh, speaking of which, I’ve addressed your bug report on my date planning. Got a really fun evening for you. It’s kind of a surprise.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right. Terrific. Well, let me just go find a pair of shoes that aren’t so tall. We wouldn’t want you to feel like you were out for a walk with your mommy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. Oh. Here’s my list for you, right there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, fair enough. I certainly can be quieter when we kiss. I thought it was an expression of passion, but if it’s coming across as juicy and weird, who wants that? Uh, uh, I’m sorry, can you be more specific on how my eyebrows are stupid? Nah, never mind, it’s right here.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good timing. Dinner’s almost ready.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, smells amazing in here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, what are we eating?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, an exotic little treat. I was just talking to Siri about Peking duck, and she said she knew about four Chinese grocers, two of which were fairly close to me. Her spontaneity is contagious.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Who’s Siri? Is he dating somebody new?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes. His phone.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh. Is that cute or creepy?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can I pour you some wine? I think you’ll enjoy it. The traditional choice with Peking duck is a Sauvignon Blanc, but Siri suggested an off-dry Riesling. I wasn’t sure, but I didn’t want to have an argument with her in the middle of Trader Joe’s. Now, what should we put Siri in for dinner? Leopard, sparkles, or to paraphrase Coco Chanel, you can never go wrong with a little black case. Siri, play some smooth jazz.

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: Playing smooth jazz.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, my God, Kenny G? This woman can read me like a book. I can’t believe I bought my soul mate at Glendale Galleria.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know if I want to stay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This is amazing. How did you even get this idea?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I called your dad. I asked him what things you liked to do when you were a kid. This seemed easier than getting a cow out here so you could tip it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, you’re kind of really great.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You mean for a person whose neck massages feel like an eagle is trying to carry you to its nest?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, bug report. I just complimented you. You should take it and shut up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right. Sorry, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And stop apologizing all the time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, let’s shoot stuff. You want me to show you what to do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I play a lot of Grand Theft Auto. I think I know how to handle a gat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow. You are cute when you get all gangsta.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, I’ve got a gunshot wound. That’s pretty badass.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, you’ve got a Reebok with a gunshot wound and an ouchie on your pinkie toe.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hello? They gave me a Band-Aid. Hospitals do not issue Band-Aids unless it is medically necessary. That is the law.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, thank you for a really cool evening.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you for hiding my Star Wars socks at the emergency room. Is it a good time to evaluate the beta test and see where we stand?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Things are looking good.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, are we still taking things slow? Because a gunshot wound today, last week, I slammed my thumb in the kitchen drawer. We don’t know how much time I have.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good night, you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Guten Tag, das YouTube. Ich bin ein Bavarian.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Und ich bin eine pretzel!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Und dis is Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Mit…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Flags.

utterance.speaker: Receptionist
utterance.content: First door on the left.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: Dave, I found six vacuum cleaner repair shops in your area. Four are fairly close to you. Hello, sexy. What can I help you with? If you’d like to make love to me, just tell me. I’m sorry. I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: Raj (waking from a dream)
utterance.content: No!
